body_content.explanation: something that someone says or writes officially, or an action done to express an opinion:
examples: The government is expected to issue a statement about the investigation to the press.
He produced a signed statement from the prisoner.
He threw paint over the fur coats because he wanted to make a statement about cruelty to animals.
We were not surprised by their statement that jobs would be cut.

body_content.explanation: a record of the amounts of money paid into and taken out of your bank account during a particular period of time:
examples: Check you statement and see if the money has been taken from your bank account.
He keeps all his bank statements and files them away.

body_content.explanation: a document that gives details of a the special needs of a child with a particular disability or problem and any extra help he or she should receive at school:
examples: Around a quarter of the class has a statement.
Our son, who has a statement of educational needs, goes to a mainstream school.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to a piece of clothing, jewellery, etc. that is designed to be very noticeable and stylish:
examples: People don't mind spending £500 for a statement piece.

body_content.explanation: to officially give a child with a particular disability or problem a statement of educational needs:
examples: My five-year-old grandson has a speech impediment for which he has been statemented.
She is specially trained to work with statemented children.
